intro: Lotononis macra, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its vibrant, showy flowers that come in a variety of colors. The plant has a compact rosette of fleshy, dark green leaves that help it retain moisture in its native environment. It produces small, tubular flowers that are often clustered in inflorescences at the tips of its stems. Lotononis macra is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
